授業方法: Orientation, consultation, guidance and assessment before, during and after the internship

トピック.授業計画1:
Pre-departure programme:
1. Initial orientation and expression of their interest areas and organizations (at the beginning of first year)
2. Assignment of students to relevant professors, and consultation with advising professors.
3. Search for internship opportunities and selection of a number of posts.
4. Preparation of internship documents, including letter of intent and curriculum vitae
5. Contacting organizations and sending applications (3-6 months before internship)
6. Screening and interviews, acceptance of interns by selected organization/s
7. Preparation for departure and departure

During internship:
1. Arrival, initial guidance, confirmation of terms of reference, and settlement. (first reporting)
2. Periodical and mid-term consultation with professors (email or video conference based)
3. Completion of internship assignment and assessment of internship by supervising officer. (As per Evaluation sheet)

After internship:
1. Final reporting on internship
2. Updating students’ career and competency development plans based on internship experience.
トピック.授業外学習2: This internship is a commitment and an opportunity for students to emulate job application and to have hands-on experience, thus should be taken seriously throughout the internship processes. Students are expected to enhance their UN competencies including their core values and core competencies, as well as their understanding of the organization that they will apply for and intern with.
